title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Senators press NIH director on killed grants and proposal to slash agency’s funding
items.description: Bhattacharya says NIH’s final budget will be “a collaboration”

items.title: Trump’s proposed cut to giant physics experiment could snuff out new form of astronomy
items.description: Degrading LIGO’s observations of gravitational waves would amount to “killing a newborn baby,” one astrophysicist says

items.title: Science’s reform movement should have seen Trump’s call for ‘gold standard science’ coming, critics say
items.description: Efforts to improve the rigor of research may have unwittingly handed the administration a way to attack science

items.title: RFK Jr.’s purge of CDC vaccine advisers prompts outrage
items.description: Health secretary will soon name new members to expert group that recommends shots

items.title: NIH terminates network aimed at stopping pandemics before they start
items.description: Agency calls research to identify viral threats “unsafe”

items.title: Open-access revolution is squeezing scientific societies’ budgets, survey shows
items.description: Decline in journal revenues puts scholarships, advocacy, and other activities at risk

items.title: Immune cells can make female deer grow antlers
items.description: Macrophages help male deer build their impressive headgear, new study suggests

items.title: Trump budget proposes killing nursing research institute
items.description: A tiny sliver of NIH, it has provided an evidence base for bedside care, shrinking mortality and saving dollars

items.title: NIH staff and biomedical community sound alarm about agency politicization, funding slowdown
items.description: In test of NIH director’s support of dissent, NIH staff sign Bethesda Declaration urging reversal of grant cuts and freezes

items.title: As war rages in Gaza, archaeological looting in the West Bank has spiked
items.description: Economic collapse in Palestinian territories has led to illegal digs at prominent Bronze Age site, new study finds
